adjectives.description: stinted (comparative more stinted, superlative most stinted)

examples: Mr. Home himself offered me a handsome sum—thrice my present salary—if I would accept the office of companion to his daughter. I declined. I think I should have declined had I been poorer than I was, and with scantier fund of resource, more stinted narrowness of future prospect.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of stint
